en.title: Pharmacology and pharmacokinetics
en.library_recommends:
• "Principles of pharmacology : the pathophysiologic basis of drug therapy / David E. Golan ... [et al.]". Year:2012. ISBN:978-1-4511-1805-6
  • "Rang and Dale's pharmacology / H.P. Rang ...[et al.]". Year:2012. ISBN:978-0-7020-3471-8

free_text.Prérequis: Bachelor in Life Sciences and Technology or equivalent, i.e. physiology, cell and molecular biology, maths
free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: Handouts and reference publications will be given during the course or placed on the moodle site of the course.[br/]Most of the topics are covered in the following reference textbooks:[br/][li]"Rang and Dale's pharmacology " by H.P. Rang et al., Elsevier/Churchill Livingstone, 2011[br/][li]"Principles of Pharmacology" by DE Golan et al., Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2008. [br/]
free_text.Contenu: [li] Introduction to Pharmacology and general topics of pharmacology[br/][li] Pharmacodynamics: Drug-target interaction, quantitative description of ligand binding, relationship between ligand binding and functional effect, antagonism; exercises[br/][li] Classes of drug targets: functional and structural aspects, strategies of drug targeting; examples[br/][li] Pharmacokinetics: principal models and parameters, Drug Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion (ADME)[br/][li] Chronopharmacology: effect of circadian rhythm on drug action[br/][li] Pharmacogenetics: candidate genes for variable drug response.[br/][li] Toxicology (e-learning): toxicity mechanisms, risk evaluation, descriptive toxicology[br/][li] Online auto-evaluation questionnaires  [br/][li] Article-based and case-based learning (pharmacokinetics modeling)[br/]
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: This course introduces the basic concepts of pharmacology, including pharmacodynamics, pharmacokinetics, pharmacogenetics and chrono-pharmacology. These topics will be illustrated by a range of concrete biomedical examples as well as by a series of exercises on drug-receptor interactions.
